description: Two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; single storey front infill extension
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">The
proposed two-storey side to rear extensions, in conjunction with the single rear ex</span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">tension,
by reason of their excessive cumulative scale, excessive bulk, poor and i</span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">nconsistent
roof design and failure to harmonise with the host property, would result in an
incongruous, overly dominant, and visually obtrusive form of&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">development residing along the shared boundary with No. 7 Pickwick Place appearing at odds with the prevailing visual character of both the host&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">property
and wider setting of the Conservation Area.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin">&nbsp;</span></p><p>











<span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Calibri&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-hansi-theme-font:
minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-ansi-language:EN-GB;mso-fareast-language:
EN-GB;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA">As such, the proposal would fail to preserve or
enhance the Conservation Area, and &nbsp;is
contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy
Framework (2023), Policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy
CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policies DM1, DM6, DM7 and of the
Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010), The Setting
of Heritage Assets Historic Environment Good Practice Advice in Planning Note 3
(Second Edition) and Roxborough Park and the Grove Conservation Area Appraisal
and Management Strategy</span><br></p>
